helpers module

helpers.download_ai_img(img_prompt: str, image_file_name: str = 'image.png') → bool[source]

Download an AI-generated image from the DALL·E 2 API, utilizing a provided prompt using openai.Image.create().

Parameters:

  • img_prompt (str) – The prompt that will be used by DALL-E 2 to generate the image.

  • image_file_name (str) – The name of the image file that will be saved (Default: “image.png”).

Returns:

True ifsuccessfully downloaded AI-generated image

Return type:

bool

Raises:

SystemExit – If the request is unsuccessful.

helpers.get_random_movie_title() → str[source]

Get a random movie title from the top 1000 rated movies on MoviesMiniDatabase using RapidAPI using request.get().

Returns:

A string containing a movie title.

Return type:

str

Raises:

SystemExit – If the request is unsuccessful.

helpers.guess_string(answer: str, attempts: int = 3) → bool[source]

Prompt the user to guess a string in a case-insensitive manner.

Parameters:

  • answer (str) – The correct answer that the user has to guess.

  • attempts (int) – Number of attempts the user is given to guess the string. (Default: 3)

Returns:

True if the user successfully guessed, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Raises:

  • TypeError – If the function is called with no arguments.

  • AttributeError – If the “answer” argument is not a string.

helpers.mask_string(string: str) → str[source]

Mask a string by replacing every alphanumeric character except the first one with an underscore.

Parameters:

string (str) – The input string.

Returns:

The masked string.

Return type:

str

Raises:

TypeError – If the input is not a string.

helpers.open_img(image_file_name: str = 'image.png')[source]

Open and show an image using Pillow.

helpers.print_welcome()[source]

Using pyfiglet prints a welcome message with ASCII art title and information about the AI and database used.
